name: Russia-Ukraine War
description: Full-scale Russian invasion of Ukraine, the largest conventional war in Europe since WWII. Involves trench warfare, drone warfare, and extensive civilian casualties.

timeline.event: Russia annexes Crimea; war begins in Donbas
Minsk II ceasefire agreement signed
Full-scale Russian invasion launched Feb 24
Ukraine recaptures Kherson in major counter-offensive
Battle of Bakhmut; Wagner mutiny
Ukraine strikes deep into Russian territory

name: Israel-Palestine Conflict
description: Escalated conflict following the October 2023 Hamas attack and subsequent Israeli military operations in Gaza. Massive humanitarian crisis with tens of thousands of casualties.

timeline.event: Israeli independence; first Arab-Israeli war
Six-Day War; Israel occupies Gaza and West Bank
Oslo Accords signed
Israel withdraws from Gaza; Hamas wins elections
Hamas Oct 7 attack; Israel launches Gaza offensive
ICJ genocide case filed; Rafah operation begins

name: Sudan Civil War
description: War between the Sudanese Armed Forces and the Rapid Support Forces. Has caused one of the world's worst humanitarian crises with millions displaced.

timeline.event: Darfur genocide begins under al-Bashir
Popular revolution ousts al-Bashir
Military coup dissolves transitional government
SAF-RSF war erupts in Khartoum
RSF accused of ethnic cleansing in Darfur

name: Myanmar Civil War
description: Multi-front civil war following the 2021 military coup. Ethnic armed organizations and peoples defense forces fighting against the military junta.

timeline.event: Military seizes power for the first time
Rohingya genocide; mass displacement
Military coup ousts Aung San Suu Kyi
Operation 1027: resistance forces capture key towns
Junta loses control of large border territories

name: Syrian Conflict
description: Ongoing multi-party conflict involving the Syrian government, opposition forces, Kurdish groups, ISIS remnants, and foreign interventions by Turkey, Russia, Iran, and the US.

timeline.event: Arab Spring protests; civil war begins
ISIS declares caliphate across Syria and Iraq
Russia intervenes militarily to support Assad
Turkey invades northeast Syria
HTS advances; Assad regime weakens

name: Yemen Conflict / Houthi Crisis
description: Long-running civil war between Houthi forces and the internationally recognized government. Houthis have expanded to Red Sea shipping attacks affecting global trade.

timeline.event: Arab Spring topples President Saleh
Houthis seize capital Sanaa
Saudi-led coalition begins airstrikes
UN-brokered truce temporarily holds
Houthis attack Red Sea shipping; US/UK strikes back

name: Ethiopia Internal Conflicts
description: Post-Tigray War instability with ongoing ethnic violence in Amhara and Oromia regions despite the 2022 ceasefire agreement.

timeline.event: Abiy Ahmed becomes PM; Nobel Peace Prize in 2019
Tigray War erupts between federal forces and TPLF
Pretoria ceasefire agreement signed
Amhara Fano militia insurgency escalates
Ongoing ethnic violence in multiple regions

name: Eastern DRC Conflict
description: Escalating conflict in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo involving M23 rebels backed by Rwanda, plus dozens of other armed groups fighting over minerals and territory.

timeline.event: Second Congo War begins — "Africa's World War"
M23 briefly captures Goma
M23 defeated; rebels disband
M23 resurges with Rwandan backing
M23 captures Goma; regional crisis intensifies

name: Somalia - Al-Shabaab Insurgency
description: Al-Shabaab insurgency against the Somali federal government, with ongoing military operations and frequent attacks on civilians and government targets.

timeline.event: Somali state collapses; civil war begins
Al-Shabaab emerges as insurgent force
AMISOM drives al-Shabaab from Mogadishu
Deadliest truck bombing in Mogadishu kills 600+
Major government offensive against al-Shabaab

name: Sahel Jihadist Insurgency
description: Expanding jihadist insurgency across Mali, Burkina Faso, and Niger. Military juntas have seized power in all three countries, expelling French and UN forces.

timeline.event: Tuareg rebellion and Islamist takeover of northern Mali
French Operation Serval intervenes
Mali military coup; France begins withdrawal
Niger coup; Wagner replaces French forces
Sahel states form Alliance of Sahel States

name: Haiti Gang Violence Crisis
description: Near-total state collapse with armed gangs controlling much of Port-au-Prince. Massive humanitarian crisis with widespread displacement and food insecurity.

timeline.event: Devastating earthquake kills 200,000+
President Moïse assassinated
Gangs control 80% of Port-au-Prince
Kenya-led multinational security force deploys

name: Taiwan Strait Tensions
description: Escalating tensions between China and Taiwan with regular PLA military exercises around the island. Considered one of the highest risks for great-power conflict.

timeline.event: ROC government retreats to Taiwan
Third Taiwan Strait Crisis; US carrier deployment
Pelosi visit triggers massive PLA exercises
Lai Ching-te inaugurated; China conducts drills

name: South China Sea Disputes
description: Ongoing maritime disputes between China and Southeast Asian nations, particularly the Philippines, with frequent confrontations between coast guards and navies.

timeline.event: Scarborough Shoal standoff between China and Philippines
Hague tribunal rules against China's nine-dash line
China-Philippines clashes at Second Thomas Shoal
Water cannon and ramming incidents escalate

name: Korean Peninsula Tensions
description: Persistent tensions on the Korean Peninsula with North Korean missile tests, nuclear development, and reported troop deployments to support Russia in Ukraine.

timeline.event: Korean War begins
Armistice signed; peninsula remains divided
North Korea conducts first nuclear test
ICBM tests; "fire and fury" crisis
DPRK troops reportedly deploy to Russia

name: Iran-Israel Shadow War
description: Escalating shadow war including direct missile exchanges, proxy conflicts through Hezbollah and Houthis, cyber warfare, and nuclear program tensions.

timeline.event: Iranian Revolution; relations severed
Stuxnet cyber-attack on Iran's nuclear program
US kills IRGC commander Soleimani
Iran launches direct missile attack on Israel
Israel strikes Iranian air defenses in response

name: Afghanistan - Taliban Rule / ISIS-K
description: Taliban rule with ongoing ISIS-K attacks and a severe humanitarian crisis. Women's rights have been almost entirely eliminated. Economic collapse continues.

timeline.event: US invasion topples Taliban after 9/11
Osama bin Laden killed in Pakistan
US-Taliban Doha Agreement signed
US withdrawal; Taliban retakes Kabul
Taliban bans women from education and work

name: Pakistan - TTP Insurgency & Instability
description: Rising TTP (Pakistani Taliban) attacks, Balochistan separatist violence, and deep political instability following contested elections.

timeline.event: TTP formed; Benazir Bhutto assassinated
Army launches Operation Zarb-e-Azb in Waziristan
Imran Khan ousted; political crisis deepens
TTP attacks surge after Afghan Taliban takeover
Balochistan separatist attacks intensify

name: Armenia-Azerbaijan Post-War Tensions
description: Ongoing tensions following Azerbaijan's takeover of Nagorno-Karabakh in 2023. Ethnic Armenian population fully displaced. Border demarcation disputes continue.

timeline.event: Karabakh conflict begins as USSR collapses
Ceasefire; Armenian forces control Karabakh
44-day war; Azerbaijan recaptures most territory
Azerbaijan seizes Karabakh; Armenian exodus
Peace treaty negotiations between Armenia and Azerbaijan

name: Lebanon Crisis
description: Multi-layered crisis including Israeli military operations against Hezbollah, economic collapse, political dysfunction, and massive displacement.

timeline.event: Israel-Hezbollah war; UN Resolution 1701
Economic collapse and mass protests
Beirut port explosion devastates capital
Cross-border escalation after Oct 7
Israel strikes Hezbollah leadership; ground incursion

name: Libya Political Division
description: Libya remains split between rival governments in Tripoli and Benghazi with competing armed forces. Oil infrastructure is frequently contested.

timeline.event: NATO-backed uprising topples Gaddafi
Country splits between rival governments
Haftar's offensive on Tripoli fails
Ceasefire agreement; unity government formed
Elections still postponed; oil disputes continue

name: Iraq - Militia Activity & ISIS Remnants
description: Iranian-backed militias conduct attacks on US bases, while ISIS cells carry out sporadic attacks. Political tensions between factions continue.

timeline.event: US-led invasion topples Saddam Hussein
ISIS captures Mosul; caliphate declared
Iraqi forces recapture Mosul from ISIS
US kills Soleimani in Baghdad airstrike
Iran-backed militias attack US bases

name: Colombia Internal Conflict
description: Despite the 2016 peace deal, FARC dissident groups, ELN guerrillas, and drug cartels continue to drive violence. Peace talks with ELN have stalled.

timeline.event: FARC guerrilla movement founded
Plan Colombia; major US military aid
Historic FARC peace agreement signed
Gustavo Petro elected; "Total Peace" policy
ELN peace talks stall; FARC dissidents active

name: Mexico Drug War
description: Ongoing extreme violence driven by drug cartels, with tens of thousands of homicides annually. Cartel territorial battles and fentanyl trafficking are major crises.

timeline.event: President Calderón declares war on cartels
43 students kidnapped in Ayotzinapa
El Chapo convicted in US court
Sinaloa Cartel fragments after arrests
Fentanyl crisis drives record US-Mexico tensions

name: Mozambique - Cabo Delgado Insurgency
description: ISIS-affiliated insurgency in Cabo Delgado province threatening natural gas projects. Combined with political crisis following disputed elections.

timeline.event: Islamist insurgency begins in Cabo Delgado
Militants seize Palma; Rwanda deploys troops
SADC forces help recapture key towns
Disputed elections trigger political crisis

name: India - Kashmir / Naxalite Conflicts
description: Ongoing tensions in Indian-administered Kashmir with militant infiltration and security operations. Maoist (Naxalite) insurgency continues in central India.

timeline.event: Partition of India; first Kashmir war
Kargil War between India and Pakistan
Uri attack; India conducts surgical strikes
India revokes Kashmir's special autonomy (Article 370)
First Kashmir elections since autonomy revoked

name: Cameroon Anglophone Crisis
description: Armed conflict between Cameroonian military and Ambazonian separatists in English-speaking regions. Thousands killed and hundreds of thousands displaced.

timeline.event: Lawyers and teachers strike over Francophone dominance
Ambazonia declares independence; armed conflict begins
Ambazonian leaders arrested and sentenced
Conflict entrenched; education crisis in NW/SW regions

name: Venezuela Political Crisis
description: Ongoing political crisis following disputed 2024 elections. Maduro government crackdown on opposition. Economic crisis drives mass migration across the Americas.

timeline.event: Maduro succeeds Chávez; economic decline begins
Guaidó declares interim presidency; dual government crisis
Barbados Agreement; opposition candidate barred
Disputed elections; Maduro claims victory amid protests

name: Nigeria Multi-Front Violence
description: Multiple simultaneous crises: Boko Haram/ISWAP insurgency in the northeast, banditry in the northwest, farmer-herder conflicts, and separatist tensions.

timeline.event: Boko Haram insurgency begins in northeast
276 schoolgirls kidnapped in Chibok
ISWAP splits from Boko Haram
Banditry surges in northwest; mass kidnappings
Multi-front violence continues; economic crisis
